question:
In each of the following cases, state whether the function is one-one, onto or bijective.
Justify your answer.
(i) $f: \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ defined by $f(x) = 3 - 4x$
solution:
(i) $f: \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ is defined as $f(x) = 3 - 4x$.

Let $x_1, x_2 \in \mathbb{R}$ such that $f(x_1) = f(x_2)$.

$\Rightarrow 3 - 4x_1 = 3 - 4x_2$

$\Rightarrow -4x_1 = -4x_2$

$\Rightarrow x_1 = x_2$

$\therefore f$ is one-one.

For any real number $(y)$ in $\mathbb{R}$, there exists $\frac{3 - y}{4}$ in $\mathbb{R}$ such that

$f\left(\frac{3 - y}{4}\right) = 3 - 4\left(\frac{3 - y}{4}\right) = y$.

$\therefore f$ is onto.

Hence, $f$ is bijective.
